Text:
It would be helpful to know what your bandwidth limits are... i.e. if you are on, for example, a connection with 3.0Mbps down and 512Kbps up you will top out at 64KB/s (bits verus bytes) but that does not account for TCP overhead (i.e. the data required to transmit packets)  I am on such a connection and usually top out at 48KB/s.

Details on KBps vs. Kbps at http://fredthemole.blogspot.com
sorry about the multiple postys, didn't realize that would happen when I hit the refresh button :P
